Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cecropin P2 (CP2, natural AMPs; roundworms, nematode, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemically synthesized Ascaris cecropins were bactericidal against a wide range of microbes, i.e. Gram-positive S. aureus, B. subtilis and M. luteus and Gram-negative P. aeruginosa, S. typhimurium, S. marcescens and E. coli bacteria, and were weakly but detectably active against yeasts S. cerevisiae and C. albicans. PDF? Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Pillai A, Ueno S, Zhang H, Lee JM, Kato Y.2005
Literature Information.Title: Cecropin P1 and novel nematode cecropins: a bacteria-inducible antimicrobial peptide family in the nematode Ascaris suum
